thread.title: It isn't the holidays without tasty cuisine on tap
thread.title_full: It isn't the holidays without tasty cuisine on tap

author: Greg Williams
title: It isn't the holidays without tasty cuisine on tap
text:
It isn’t the holidays without tasty cuisine on tap
The holiday season certainly wouldn’t be filling without some delicious homemade food.
From pumpkin to pot pie and chicken barbecue to sipping coffee and wine tastings, there is an abundance of food on the menu of things to do. Check out this events:
Food for sale
• Homemade pot pie sale, 4 to 7 p.m. Friday, Turbett Grange, 12561 Route 333 East, Port Royal. Warm up your Friday night with homemade chicken and ham pot pie — made with love and ready to take home. No dine-in meals available, so swing by, grab your quarts and enjoy a cozy meal wherever you are. $12.50 per quart.
• Christmas Sip and Shop, 9 a.m. to 2 p.m. Saturday Rec Park Community Center, 108 Montgomery Ave., Lewistown. More than 50 small businesses and food vendors with food, coffee, wine tastings, local artisans and more.
• Chicken barbecue, 11 a.m. to 4 p.m. Saturday, Fremont Fire Department, 8641 Route 104, Mount Pleasant Mills. Leg quarters cost $4 and platters are $12. Platters include a leg quarter, macaroni and cheese, baked beans and a roll. Proceeds benefit the fire department.
• Veterans Day meal, courtesy of Church of the Open Door, 5 to 7 p.m. Saturday, McAlisterville Community Building, 115 School St., McAlisterville. Reserve your spot by calling Michelle at (717) 443-4081.
Bazaars and festivals
• Port Royal Lutheran Church Holiday Bazaar, 8 a.m. to 2 p.m. Friday and Saturday, church social room, Port Royal Lutheran Church, 402 Market St., Port Royal. Large selection of new and gently used artificial Christmas trees, crafts and holiday items, baked goods including cookies and party mixes. Soup by the quart costs $10 for chicken corn or vegetable beef. No pre-order necessary. Proceeds go to the church’s social ministry fund.
• Juniata Valley International Gifts Sale, 9 a.m. to 7 p.m. Friday and 9 a.m. to 3 p.m. Saturday, Cedar Grove Brethren in Christ Church, 287 Deerville Road, Mifflintown. Shop the wares of skilled artisans in Africa, Asia and Latin America. Baked goods will also be offered this year. Handcrafted items marketed by Ten Thousand Villages, SERRV, Women at Risk, Education and More and many others.
• Beacon Fall Fest, 10 a.m. to 3 p.m. Saturday, Beacon Lodge Camp, 114 Route 103 South, Mount Union. Festival activities include outdoor bowling, mini golf, pony rides, golf cart tours of the campgrounds, fall-themed games and more. There’s also live music with a deejay, delicious foods, a variety of crafts and vendors and raffles and prizes. For more information, call (814) 542-2511.
Live entertainment
• Remember When, 6 to 8 p.m. Friday, Seven Mountains Wine Cellars, 324 Decker Valley Road, Spring Mills.
• Nathan Peterson, 6 to 9 p.m. Friday, Bierhaus, 10141 Route 522 South, Lewistown.
• Jaded Duo, 7 to 9 p.m. Friday, Hungry Run Wine Bar and Bistro, 10042 Route 522 South, Lewistown.
• Music Trivia with Ffej, 2 to 4 p.m. Saturday, Shy Bear Brewing, 35 Meadowbrook Lane, Lewistown.
• Nathan Peterson, 6 to 9 p.m. Saturday, Hungry Run Distillery, 10 Ridens Road, Lewistown.
• Save Thanksgiving Benefit Concert, 6 to 10 p.m. Saturday, Port Royal Community Building, 212 W. Fourth St., Port Royal. Admission is by donation for Juniata County Food Pantry.
• Ryan Russler, 7 to 9 p.m. Saturday, Hungry Run Wine Bar and Bistro, 10042 Route 522 South, Lewistown.
• JazzTrax, 1 to 4 p.m. Sunday, Seven Mountains Wine Cellars, 324 Decker Valley Road, Spring Mills.
• Waddington Brothers, 3 to 5 p.m. Sunday, Mifflin County High School, 501 Sixth St., Lewistown.
• Sean Farley, 4 to 7 p.m. Sunday, Shy Bear Brewing, 35 Meadowbrook Lane, Lewistown.
ROFF Cattery Coffee Shop
Come meet Rescue Our Furry Friends’ adoptable cats and kittens at their first Coffee House on Saturday, from 9 a.m. to 2 p.m. Bring a book, friends, puzzle, crafts or just yourself and enjoy a chill environment surrounded by kitties. If you’re looking to adopt, this is a great event! ROFF has more than 25 kittens and cats ready for their fur-ever homes. There will be coffee, hot chocolate, baked goods and more available for purchase that day. Admission is $5 for an adult with a child and $10 for a family. Application fee is $30.
Stone Arch Players on stage
Stone Arch Players present “The New Kid on the Block,” 7:30 p.m. Fridays and Saturdays through Nov. 22 and 2 p.m. Sunday, Nov. 16 and 23, Theatre in the Park, Kishacoquillas Park, Lewistown. Carl, Lloyd and Parker, three older gentlemen who share a large home, need to rent out their fourth bedroom to help with the rent. Their problem seems answered when Will shows up … except Will turns out to be a lady. $15 for general admission tickets. For tickets, visit https://stonearchplayers.csstix.com.
Have an event coming up? Email the details to events@lewistownsentinel.com by 5 p.m. Tuesday the week of the event. “Things to Do” is typically published on Thursdays in The Sentinel.
